40815310.review: The thing is, while it does have its virtues, this game isn't really THAT great in terms of creativity. In fact, everything is pretty much the same as the first Peggle game. The levels are pretty much the same. The characters are pretty the same. Heck, even the MUSIC is pretty much the same. The only thing that's really notable about this game is that a lot of it borrows backgrounds, voices, and other elements from Half-Life 2 (among other games) while still just being Peggle in terms of actual gameplay (which is why it's rated T for Teen), so if you want that, fine, get it. Trust me, at least you won't be disappointed on THAT count at least. In fact, considering the game's actually free, you get a lot more than you might think (10 levels and 5 challenges, which still only took me a weekend to get through). Other than that, start with the E-rated original (which this game's credits ironically recommend). I'm not saying this is a bad game. All I'm saying is that it's just not all that "Extreme" as the title might suggest.

33924286.review:
Peggle Extreme is a simplified introduction to the Peggle games and can be picked up any time for some casual puzzling. How the game is played, either by trial and error or more strategically, is entirely subject to whim.

Within ten levels, five challenges and the help of one playable character, namely the Peggle Master Björn the unicorn, Peggle Extreme teaches the most basic mechanics that are needed to understand the Peggle ruleset. By and large, the game is very much akin to many arcade games that involve a ball to hit specific targets in a 2D environment. It's a twisted mix of pinball and Breakout with the exception that the player has more than enough time to potentially plan the next shot.

The otherwise colourful, child-friendly graphics and sounds are interspersed with images based on Valve's games and a few of their respective voice lines. Its difficulty is rather easy with a little bump when tackling the Master Challenges. The winning shot slow motion, glittering fireworks and the playing of the Ode to Joy feel a little over the top rewarding but that's part of the game's appeal.

Peggle Extreme is a charming bite-sized puzzler perfect as an in-between snack.

30525526.review:
THIS GAME is amazing! SOoo addicting! Peggle Extreme is free to play! That's a big plus! It's different from the other Peggle games because it has it's own Portal / Half-Life / Team Fortress theme. Also it's more of a shortened version in comparison to the original Peggle game. If you like puzzle games and pinball games you're good to go with this one!

What do you have to do in this game?
You have to shoot your ball from the top of the srceen downwards and clear the orange squares in order to complete a level.
Your ball can fall in the pitt below when it's done bouncing around, but there is a ballbucket that moves constantly from side to side. That's where the ball you shot can fall into. When that happens your ball get's spared. When you begin a level you start of with 10 balls. You can earn extra balls if your ballscore is high enough which you can achieve by planning and timing your shots just right. Most of the time there is luck involved in this game. 

There are different types of squares that you can hit with your ball. Blue, orange, purple and green.
They all have a different purpose and give you power ups or extra points. 
Blue squares (They are called Pegs) are normal point. 
Orange Pegs are the ones you need to clear in a level to complete it and they give you more points then the blue ones.
Purple Pegs randomly appear on different spots and are always alone. This is some sort of multiplyer Peg that gives you a great deal of points, because every other Peg you hit gets multiplied!
Green pegs come in pairs in a level and are actually a Power Up for your character named 'Bjorn'. A weird Unicorn creature.
They give you guidelines that make it easier to see which Pegs you are going to hit with your ball.

There are Different modes in this game. An Adventure mode, Quick Play, Duel and Challenges.
These different modes give you enough fun to play this game for hours! Believe me. You want to buy the other Peggle games after this, it's that fun!

23735997.review:
This review assumes you already own and have completed [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/3480]Peggle Deluxe[/url].

Game: Peggle Extreme
Developer and publisher: PopCap Games
Released: 11 September, 2011
Genre: Pachinko/Plinko
Setting: Before Peggle Deluxe, Peggle Institute, somewhere in the multiverse
Spoiler-free plot summary: There's been a breach in the multiverse, and headcrabs from the Half-Life universe are invading the Peggle Institute. You have to save the Institute with the help of City 17's Rebels, Counter-Terrorists, GLaDOS, and Mann Co.

Full review: Peggle Extreme is a demo exclusive to Steam, using Valve's IPs to help advertise Peggle Deluxe.

This is your standard Peggle gameplay, but only Bjorn's magic power is available. There are only ten levels and five challenge levels. The campaign is fairly easy but the challenges are quite difficult.

Do I recommend Peggle Extreme? Yes; it can entertain you for an hour or two, and is a nice piece of dessert after the meal that is Peggle Deluxe.

Peggle Extreme was an early Steam release that saw the original Peggle gameplay reskinned for Valve characters and themes from the newly-released Orange Box. This is a game that can easily be played for a few minutes on the backburner while other tasks take the forefront of your attention. The graphical options are substandard, while the control in gameplay is top-notch. Overall, this is a worthy addition to anyone's library if you're looking for a game to take your attention for a bit.

This game basically is a playable demo of the unique game Peggle. I own both Peggle 1 and Peggle 2 on Xbox 360. While Peggle 2 had new characters, Peggle 1 had more characters.

This review is basically just to say if you enjoy Peggle Extreme, I'd recommend grabbing the free demo of Peggle Deluxe and if you like that getting Peggle Complete for $8.99 (what it costs at the time of this review).

The easiest way to sum this game up is that you shoot a ball from a cannon on top of the level down towards pegs. If you can eliminate all the orange pegs before you run out of remaining balls, you'll win the stage. You can also land your balls into a bucket to receive your ball for that turn back at least in single player anyway.

This game takes precision to get high scores but it gets really fun as you get more used to it.

16808141.review:
Peggle Extreme - это бесплатная версия игры Peggle, в которую добавлены персонажи и звуки из Half-Life 2 и Team Fortress 2. Игра создавалась специально для увеличения интереса к основной игре, тем самым создатели хотели увеличить количество продаж основной игры. После прохождения данной игры вам будет предложена покупка основной игры.

Игра имеет 4 режима игры, давайте рассмотрим каждый из них:

1. Приключение

В данном режиме вам предлагается пройти приключение (игру). Вы являетесь Peggle Master'ом и вас срочно вызывают на службу в университет Peggle, в который вторглись кошмарные твари и натворили много гадостей. Ваша задача избавить университет от кошмарных тварей, блуждающий по университету. Твари могу вернуться, поэтому запаситесь шариками! Они вам пригодятся в борьбе с тварями. Боритесь за свою жизнь!

2. Быстрая игра

В данном режиме вы можете играть в отдельные уровни, которые вы разблокируете во время прохождения приключения. Ваша задача в данном режиме набрать наибольшее количество очков на выбранной карте.

3. Дуэль

Как вы могли догадаться - это режим на двоих. Здесь вы можете сыграть против своего друга или компьютера. Каждому игроку дается 6 шариков для выстрелов. Игроки выполняют выстрелы по очереди. Ваша цель набрать больше очков, чем ваш противник. Если вы не задеваете красный блок при броске, то вас штрафуют на 25% очков от очков набранных вами.

4. Вызов (Вызовы для мастера)

Проходите уровни с особыми правилами и улучшайте свои навыки, чтобы пройти окончательный тест!

Gameplay

Игра Peggle основана на японской игре патинко. Игрок имеет 10 шаров, которыми он стреляет с верхней части экрана, пытаясь попасть по цветным блокам. В чем большее количество блоков попадёт игрок, тем большее число очков он получит. После выстрела количество шаров уменьшается на один. Однако, если упадёт в двигающуюся снизу корзину, то количество шаров не изменяется. Если шар не попадёт ни в один блок, есть шанс получить дополнительный шарик. Также если игрок набирает 25 000 очков за один выстрел, то количество шаров также не изменяется. На уровнях присутствуют красные, синие, зелёные и фиолетовые блоки. Для прохождения уровня, игроку необходимо выбить все красные блоки.

Небольшие советы:

• Включайте голову, чтобы сделать наиболее удачный бросок!
• Вы можете настроить свой выстрел с помощью колеса мыши или клавиш со стрелкам.

Говорят, что игра патинко вызывает зависимость, поэтому эта игра тоже может вызвать зависимость. В связи с этим не рекомендую уделять слишком много времени на игры, сделанные на основе патинко.

В итоге могу сказать, что игра понравится не всем, но любителям патинко она точно понравится.

Оценка 10/10

14062277.review:
When I was 6 years old, my Grandmother let me use her computer. She showed me the popcap games folder she had on there. There were many games on there, Insaniquarum Deluxe, Feeding Frenzy. A whole bunch, but the one that caught my eye was Peggle. 
It was a simple-looking game, a 'casual' -looking game you could say. I thought it'd be fun to try out, the minute I launched the game and heard that glorious music, I knew I'd love it. 6-year-old me loved every second I'd played. I'd constantly ask my mother to take me back there to play it right up until I was 13 years old, between those 7 years I would say that Peggle was the greatest experience I had in my everyday life, until we moved to a town further away, I didn't think it was that big of a deal, but everynight I'd have dreams of playing Peggle, these dreams continued on for about 2 months. Up until I finally thought I was over it.
In September of 2013 I was 14-years old and created a Steam account, I tried my hand at some games such as Team Fortress 2 and Garry's mod, eventually got into CS:GO, These games were fun, but I always felt like there was this empty space in them that could have been filled. One year later, in 2014 I was looking at games on Steam to play, I didn't know what to search so I just put P... The first thing that came up was Peggle. 
I was lit with joy, I felt that same excitement I hadn't felt in years, I downloaded the game as soon as I could, it launched... That same music began blaring. I was so happy and since that day I have not given up on this game, nor ever will.
Peggle is the greatest thing that has or ever will happen to me 

10/10

13668163.review:
[h1]Описание игры:[/h1]
Бесплатная аркада в которой нам необходимо прицеливаясь скидывать шарик сверху вниз. На каждому уровне по экрану в виде разных изображений стоят стационарно другие шарики, в которые нам необходимо попасть нашим запущенным шариком. При попаданаии по цели наш шар врезается и двигается дальше пока не упадет вниз. Те шары куда мы попали пропадают после того как наш шарик оказался внизу. Нашей целью является дотронуться до всех красных шаров, которые генерируются каждый раз по новому. На все провсе у нас есть десять попыток, но в игре существует множество способов пополнить эти попытки. Всего в игре 2 акта по несколько уровней.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ Стилистика игры выполнена с использованием героев из Half Life 2, Team Fortess 2, Portal 2.
¥ Каждый раз красные шары генерируются по новому, что делает дает нам проходить один и тот же уровень разными способами не разу не повторяясь.
¥ Есть разные бонусы которые приятно радуют глаз и дают стремление пройти уровень допустим уничтожив все шары на уровне.

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Нет достижений и русского языка.

[h1]Советы:[/h1]
¥ Играйте в оконном режиме. Тогда размытая графика становится довольно милой глазу.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Очень захватывающая игра. Короткая, что понятно в ввиду ее бесплатности и наличия платного оригинала. Однозначно рекомендую для ознакомления. Мне захотелось приобрести Deluxe версию. 

[h1]Оценка:
8 из 10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

13299655.review:
Ever wondered what [i]Peggle[/i] would be like as an action game? Now's your chance.

For those who don't know, [i]Peggle[/i] is an arcade-style game, by PopCap Games, in which the player shoots balls at pegs littering the screen, the goal being to hit all the orange pegs. It's a very easy-going game, with simple graphics and music. Which is why it's surprising that [i]Peggle Extreme[/i] exists.

[i]Peggle Extreme[/i] takes the classic [i]Peggle[/i] gameplay and juxtaposes it with imagery and sounds from Valve's [i]The Orange Box[/i]. It's kinda weird to see such a laid-back game crossing over with the likes of [i]Half-Life 2[/i], [i]Team Fortress 2[/i], and [i]Portal[/i], especially since the music is the same easy-listening cheese found in the original [i]Peggle[/i]. But the gameplay remains intact, and it's well worth downloading, since you don't have to pay for it.

It only comes with 10 levels and one instructor (Bjorn the unicorn), but there are also five challenges that you can try out. It's a pretty short game, but if you're already a fan, or you've never played any game in the series, this is a great little spin-off to get, especially for free.

7 out of 10.

12830306.review:
[h1]Una introducción[/h1]
[b][i]Peggle[/b][/i] es un juego con un [i]gameplay[/i] simple: disparas una bola eligiendo únicamente la dirección para golpear unas esferas que irán desapareciendo. Hay cuatro tipos de esferas: normales, rojas, verdes y moradas. El objetivo es también simple: para completar el nivel hay que eliminar las esferas de color rojo. Las verdes te darán por un tiempo limitado un poder que varía dependiendo del personaje que tengas seleccionado. Las moradas aumentarán tu puntuación.
Claro que para lograr terminar cada nivel tienes un número limitado de bolas (diez por nivel). Podrás recuperarlas si caen en un contenedor que se mueve en el fondo u obteniendo puntos que te darán una o varias bolas dependiendo de qué tan grande es tu puntuación en el tiro. Es simple terminarlo, el verdadero reto es limpiar cada escenario. 
En específico de esta versión [b][i]Extreme[/b][/i] es una suerte de [i]demo[/i]. Cuenta con diez niveles solamente y un único personaje para jugar. Sin embargo cuenta como un juego aparte, ¿por qué?, pues porque es también un [i]crossover[/i] con algunos de los juegos de [i]Valve[/i]: [i]Half-Life, Team Fortress y Portal[/i], siendo los escenarios de este último título los más ingeniosos, aunque quizá lleguen a romper un poco el juego.
Otro punto a su favor: es gratis.

10381314.review:
Before Valve crossovers were mere fodder for pre-purchase exclusives and newly released PC ports on Steam, Peggle Extreme dared to dream, by offering Orange Box customers a unique journey into a world where Peggle, Half-Life and Team Fortress collide for no apparent reason, creating a unique story where cute animals from Peggle rebel against the extra-dimensional invaders of the Valve multiverse (here portrayed as far more genocidal than Valve would have liked). In fact, it's the same MacGyver-esque plot device that Valve resorted to when they created the Perpetual Testing Initiative story for Portal 2. Mere coincidence????

... Okay, setting aside the fanman sarcasm, Peggle Extreme is really fun, mildly replayable, and worth trying if you're ever... bored, I suppose. Give it a try!

Cet Add-On de Peggle est assez sympa ! Il y a un scénario simpliste où on incarne Bjorn la licorne-potame qui veut sauver l'Institue Peggle des Créatures venus d' autres monde mais les niveaux sont digne de la Licence et les tableaux sont pleins de références rigolotes aux titres de la Orange Box. Les "Créatures" viennent de Half-Life 2, de Team Fortress 2, Conter-Strike et de Portal. Il y a 4 niveaux de Half-Life 2, 4 niveaux de Team Fortress 2, 3 de Portal et  1 seul niveau sur Counter Strike même si il ne fait pas partit de la fameuse compilation de Valve ! Comme dans les premiers Peggles il est possible de voir un Replay d'une belle action qu'on fait ce qui est pas mal pour la frime ! :) Mais Petit Bémol n°1 : Il a un mode deux joueurs mais on peut jouer soit contre l'ordi ou avec un amis mais que en local ! *-*
Petit Bémol n°2 , certes il n'y a qu'une dizaine de niveaux vu que c'est juste du Fan Service mais faut dire que la Fin dégoute un peu même si il  faut avouer que Valve à l'Ultimate Pawa !!! ^_^
Petit Bémol n°3 : Après le Ending qui dégoûte, on a le pire placement de produit jamais fait ! Pop Cap Games décroche la Palme même Activison fait moins bien ! XD
En Bref très bonne Add-ons qui fait bien du Fan Service envers les fans des licences phares de Valve même si on peut constater le flagrant placement de produit pour Peggle Night à la fin de l'Add-ons ! :p

8580570.review:
Peggle is one of those shareware games that were quite a big thing few years ago, with wacky likeable graphic and simple gameplay, all to fit for the tastes of the wide audience of casual gamers (For example, your mom). And Peggle Extreme goes even more wacky, being a free promotional demo-version with levels taking place in universe of Valve's Orange Box games, with unicorn being the only available character. (who has his head being eaten by headcrab at title screen, scaring some part of casual audience away)

It's a completely free single player game that includes 10 exclusive levels, as been said, as well as hard 5 challenge levels for people who mastered peggle gameplay, as well as duel, with local multiplayer, where players take turns in shooting ball out. Nope, no Internet multiplayer there.

It should give you a good taste at what Peggle games are about. The gameplay was inspired by Pachinko games and been made just a bit more skill-based, while still having to guess where the ball will ricochet off. You take control of the cannon on top of screen and shoot uncontrollable ball in direction you choose, after which you are left hoping to get lucky to hit more orange pegs than just one.  You still can try to measure the timing, to get lucky to have your ball fall into basket, giving it back for free, or get one more ball by scoring a as many pegs and bonuses as possible. Out of all the pegs, orange ones, that are randomly chosen each time, are the only ones that you are required to hit to beat the level.

Graphics are random simple 2D cuteness and just randomness, and music is forgetable, aside from use of classic here and there.

Also, I don't think that it uses any of Steam features, I couldn't even bring up the Steam Overlay. Good thing this game is alt+tab friendly.

Personally, I think that this game is too much based on luck/guessing/measuring-like-a-robot, but since it's free, you should try it and decide for yourself.

1110739.review:
Peggle Extreme is a puzzle game but it is not a full game – it is only 10 levels long. It has the normal single player mode as well as several variant gameplay modes for the same levels, including Duel, Challenge and Quick Play.
The levels are inspired by Half-Life 2, Team Fortress 2 and Portal. 
The gameplay is really simple, you shoot balls down into a board of pegs with the goal of hitting certain pegs to clear the level.
The game is really short, it is easily beaten in well under half an hour, and it's replay value is very limited.
Peggle Extreme is free and it is entertaining for the first twenty minutes but not for much longer.

Sounds 6/10
Graphics 4/10
Gameplay 5/10
Atmosphere 6/10

523616.review:
Peggle Extreme is a variant of Peggle (Deluxe) from Popcap Games. It was offered with the Orange Box and it's not really a surprise: Popcap Games is also using Steam (mandatory when playing the Orange Box on PC) for broadcasting games made by them.

The story of Peggle Extreme is simple: you have to defend the Peggle Institute from invaders during 10 levels. Let me explain the gameplay. You have peggles on your screen. Peggles are these points or rectangles with different colors. Blue ones are the basic peggle, the orange ones are the ones you have to eliminate, the green ones are the speciality from your guide (in PE, it's only Bjorn the Unicorn and the fact that he can show the trajectory of your ball) and the rose one are point boosts and are chosen randomly when launching a new ball. The goal is to launch a ball and eliminate a maximum of peggles. I mean, with ten balls, you've had to eliminate every orange peggle, others being point bonuses. You have a bucket moving at the bottom and you can earn a free ball if the one currently launched falls into it.

You can also earn free balls by reaching a certain score with one ball during its play. The first step is 25.000 points. Also, you have the fevermeter. When reaching the X2, X3, etc., it increases the points tied to peggles: for example, a blue one that brings 10 points when touched is bringing 20 points when touched when your fevermeter indicates X2. And it's valid during all the level. There are also special bonuses like the long shot (touching two peegles far away from each other) or the lucky bounce (the ball touches the bucket, is bouncing and then falls into it. If it don't fall into it, the lucky bounce is missed). If your ball falls into the void without touching a peggle, you will have a coin with Free Ball or No Ball appearing. It's randomly, so, you can only pray that you'll have a second chance. That's only a view of the bonuses existing (you have extreme slide, orange attack, etc..). When finishing a level, the bucket disappeared and five special bonuses appear: 10.000 at the far left and far right, 50.000 for the two others and for the middle, it's 100.000 points. Note that if you clean your screen of all the peggles, you're unlocking Ultra Extreme Fever and all the five voids bring 100.000 points.

You have also special features for the duel mode: -25% of your points if the ball doesn't touch a peggle and falls directly in the void or in the bucket for example.

The backgrounds are customized to the Orange Box games with Peggle Masters appearing in it. Half-Life 2 Episode 2 is represented by a Vortigaunt attacking a Peggle Master, a Headcrab, a Hunter. Team Fortress is symbolized by an Heavy with a Peggle Master, a sentry build by an Engineer, a Pyro pursuing a Peggle Master and a BOOM! probably taken from a trailer. Portal is more interesting by the fact that you have portals that change the location of your ball. You have the lovely turret and the Weighed Companion Cube. Every game is featuring the voice of characters appearing in it. For HL2E2, it didn't really let a trace in my brain but for TF2, you have the voice from the Heavy, like the "You did well!". For Portal, it's our dear psycho Glados.

As you can suppose, graphics are simple, not really complicated and very cartoonish for the Peggle Masters. Backgrounds are more similar to the original graphics of the game than being cartooned. Soundtrack is also perfect.

The different modes are also challenging. Duel Mode is made for playing alone against the computer or for playing with a friend. Adventure Mode is the solo campaign. The Quick Mission is for playing unlocked levels and the Challenge Mode is for people liking Challenge. It's a sort of Bonus Map like in Portal: you have to beat the challenge for gaining the title of Peggle Master for the level: clean all the peggles, reach a certain high score: 300.000 for example, eliminate all the orange peggles (the classic gameplay). I can guarantee you that reaching a high score is easier than trying to clean your screen. Currently, I'm a Peggle Master in each level, the last title is the cleaning of the first level with the Vort.

Peggle Extreme isn't suffering from flaws, apart the shortness of the game, being a product designed for the Orange Box and the fact that you will not beat every level at your first try. Believe me, you'll find the BOOM! and the sentry levels very challenging. And wait to see the level from Portal and its three parts you can only access by taking portals.

Anyway, for me, this game is really enjoyable, if you don't try this, you don't know what you're missing. I mean, if you can afford the Orange Box or if you can buy on Steam. Peggle Extreme is probably one of the best casual games I've played and I'll admit it: seeing G-Man as the sun or Bjorn with a Headcrab is something that HL fans can't miss. Anyway, I'll recommend it. It's fun, very easy to understand and enjoyable.
